messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:48): Acid3 will bite us when we do XML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:55): does Acid3 test for XML strictness?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:57): character encoding strictness at least
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:02): acid3 tests a bunch of stuff that the specs required that the browsers didn't do, which we have since largely come to view as suboptimal
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:02): it's sad
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:03): acid2, and to some extent acid3, both predate the time where i was comfortable with just making wholesale changes to long-established specs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:03): (acid3 does sidestep some problems, like making Attr nodes optional)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:04): anyway, if the specs change then i'll happily change acid3
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:22): blatantly has bad Mozilla karma today. Thunderbird 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpears to have lost all email.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:26): All my account settings are there, but the list of folders is empty, and the list of emails doesn't even 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpear because there's no folder selected (because there are no folders)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:26): What on earth?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:31): http://stuff a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/thunderbird.png ‚Äî awesome!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:38): folderTree.json corrupt. Nice.

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is there a spec that does/could specify what the following does? http://nypop.com/ 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc/webkit/awstest.html
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:52): WebKit matches IE, but not Firefox

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:54): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: What exactly is being tested here?  The use of try/catch in on* attributes?  Or naming a function the same as a @name in the document?  Something else?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:54): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: the question is whether <elm id=foo> overrides function foo() {} ?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:54): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: the latter (i.e. order of lookup on window object)
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:54): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: name or id, whatever
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:56): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: the relative precedence of id and name would be HTML5 domain, I think
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:56): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcps/current-work/multipage/browsers.html#named-access-on-the-window-object
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:56): "supports named properties" is a webidl term iirc
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:57): http://www.w3.org/TR/WebIDL/#dfn-support-named-properties
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:57): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I'm not sure if that answers my question (I think not)
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (22:58): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: HTML5 talks about DOM, naturally, not about JS functions
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:00): Would you not expect it to depend on the order in which they are defined
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:00): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: i would expect webidl to answer this question in its JS binding section, although i don't know if it does currently
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (23:02): You probably don
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (23:02): don't want to link the WebIDL from 2008
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:10): oops
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:11): google usually gives me the dev.w3.org version
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (23:11): It seems to have stopped
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (23:11): I remember accidentally reading the TR version a while ago
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:14): horrifying experience?
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (23:15): I couldn't find the property I was looking for (because it hadn't been created in 2008)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:27): Also, why are the hybi people discussing compression? We don't even have a functional protocol yet
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:28): and the four weeks timeline is long past
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:28): Because they have no clue what they're doing?
